heading: a bee siege
subheading: a truck carrying millions of bees overturned, releasing a black cloud of angry bees that closed a highway in maine for eight hours. firefighters were helpless to deal with the situation until professional beekeepers gave them some good advice: spraying the hives with water calmed the bees so crews could load them onto another truck. one officer explained the bees were fooled into thinking the weather had changed and stayed in their hives to wait out the rain.
author: wired staff
text: a truck carrying millions of bees overturned, releasing a black cloud of angry bees that closed a highway in maine for eight hours. firefighters were helpless to deal with the situation until professional beekeepers gave them some good advice: spraying the hives with water calmed the bees so crews could load them onto another truck. one officer explained the bees were fooled into thinking the weather had changed and stayed in their hives to wait out the rain.
